Section.title: Server Installation

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The northpike server package is available from the following sources:
Regardless of the distribution method, the northpike package will contain a command named northpike that acts as the main entrypoint to all of the server and client functionality.

Subsection.title: PostgreSQL
Subsection.Paragraph: The northpike server requires a PostgreSQL server. The northpike server will create the required tables and database objects on first startup, given the name of a running PostgreSQL database, and a PostgreSQL role and password.

Subsection.title: Idstore
Subsection.Paragraph: The northpike server delegates all user and password management to idstore and therefore requires a running idstore server in order to work.

Subsection.title: Maven Central
Subsection.Paragraph:
A distribution package can be found at
Maven Central.
The northpike command requires that a Java 21+ compatible JVM be accessible via /usr/bin/env java.
Verify the integrity of the distribution zip file:

FormalItem.title: Verify
FormalItem.Verbatim: $ gpg --verify com.io7m.northpike.main-${project.version}-distribution.zip.asc gpg: assuming signed data in 'com.io7m.northpike.main-${project.version}-distribution.zip.asc' gpg: Signature made Tue 28 Jun 2022 15:01:56 GMT gpg: using RSA key 3CCE59428B30462D10459909C5607DA146E128B8 gpg: issuer "contact@io7m.com" gpg: using pgp trust model gpg: Good signature from "io7m.com (2022 maven-rsa-key) <contact@io7m.com>" [unknown]

Subsection.Paragraph: Unzip the zip file, and set up the environment appropriately. The northpike command expects an environment variable named NORTHPIKE_HOME to be defined that points to the installation directory.

FormalItem.title: Extract
FormalItem.Verbatim: $ unzip com.io7m.northpike.main-${project.version}-distribution.zip $ export NORTHPIKE_HOME=$(realpath northpike) $ ./northpike/bin/northpike northpike: usage: northpike [command] [arguments ...] ...

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The northpike package uses PostgreSQL for all persistent data.

Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The northpike package sets up multiple roles during database initialization. The configured roles have different degrees of privileges in order to allow, for example, external systems such as database metrics collectors read-only access to the database. All the defined rules are declared with the built-in PostgreSQL restrictions such as nocreatedb, nocreaterole, etc.

During the startup of the northpike server, the server will connect to the database using the owner role and do any database table initialization and/or schema upgrades necessary. The server will then disconnect from the database, and then connect to the database again using the worker role. The worker role is then used for normal operation of the server; if this role is somehow compromised, the role only has a limited ability to do any damage to the database, and cannot affect the audit log at all.

Subsection.title: Owner
Subsection.Paragraph: The owner role is the role that owns the database and is permitted to create tables, create new roles, etc. This role is used by the northpike package when creating the database during the first run of the server, and for upgrading database schemas later. Administrators are free to pick the name of the role, although it is recommended that the role be named northpike_install to make it clear as to the purpose of the role.
If the PostgreSQL OCI image is used, it is common to have the image create this role automatically using the POSTGRES_USER and POSTGRES_PASSWORD variables:

FormalItem.title: Example
FormalItem.Verbatim: $ podman run \ --name some-postgres \ -e POSTGRES_USER=northpike_install \ -e POSTGRES_PASSWORD=mysecretpassword \ -d postgres

Subsection.title: Worker
Subsection.Paragraph: The worker role is the role that is used for normal database operation. It is a role that has read/write access to all tables (except for the audit log which is restricted to being append-only), although it is not granted the ability to create new tables, drop tables, or do other schema manipulation. The role is always named northpike, and adminstrators are required to set a password for this role.

Subsection.title: Reader
Subsection.Paragraph: The reader role is a role that is permitted read-only access to some of the database. It is effectively an optional role that can be used by various database metrics systems if required. If a password is not specified for the role in the server's configuration file, then logging in is not permitted at all.

Section.Footnote: If running under podman or docker, remember to use the -i and -t options.
